theorem closure_inter_open_left
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X}
    (hA : IsOpen (A : Set X)) :
    closure (A ∩ B : Set X) = closure (A ∩ closure (B : Set X)) := by
  -- First inclusion: monotonicity of `closure`.
  have h₁ : (A ∩ B : Set X) ⊆ A ∩ closure (B : Set X) := by
    intro x hx
    exact ⟨hx.1, subset_closure hx.2⟩
  have hSub₁ : closure (A ∩ B : Set X) ⊆
      closure (A ∩ closure (B : Set X)) :=
    closure_mono h₁
  -- Second inclusion: use the neighbourhood characterisation of `closure`.
  have hSub₂ :
      closure (A ∩ closure (B : Set X)) ⊆ closure (A ∩ B : Set X) := by
    intro x hx
    -- `x ∈ A ∩ closure B`.
    rcases hx with ⟨hxA, hxClB⟩
    -- We show `x ∈ closure (A ∩ B)` via `mem_closure_iff`.
    have hx' : x ∈ closure (A ∩ B : Set X) := by
      -- Neighbourhood argument.
      have : ∀ U : Set X, IsOpen U → x ∈ U →
          (U ∩ (A ∩ B) : Set X).Nonempty := by
        intro U hU_open hxU
        -- Intersect the neighbourhood with `A`, still open and contains `x`.
        let V : Set X := U ∩ A
        have hV_open : IsOpen V := hU_open.inter hA
        have hxV : x ∈ V := ⟨hxU, hxA⟩
        -- Density property from `hxClB`.
        have hNonempty : (V ∩ B : Set X).Nonempty :=
          (mem_closure_iff).1 hxClB V hV_open hxV
        -- Repackage the point for the required intersection.
        rcases hNonempty with ⟨y, ⟨⟨hyU, hyA⟩, hyB⟩⟩
        exact ⟨y, ⟨hyU, ⟨hyA, hyB⟩⟩⟩
      -- Apply the characterisation of the closure.
      exact (mem_closure_iff).2 this
    exact hx'
  -- Combine the two inclusions.
  exact Set.Subset.antisymm hSub₁ hSub₂

theorem closure_inter_closure_subset_left
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X} :
    closure (A ∩ closure (B : Set X) : Set X) ⊆ closure (A : Set X) := by
  -- The set `A ∩ closure B` is obviously contained in `A`.
  have hSub : (A ∩ closure (B : Set X) : Set X) ⊆ A := by
    intro x hx
    exact hx.1
  -- Taking closures preserves inclusions, yielding the desired result.
  exact closure_mono hSub
